Th erefore, the woman should be advised not to push actively until 
the foetal head is distending the perineum. 
/circle6  Occasionally, the woman may feel the urge to push before the cervix is fully 
dilated. Th is must be discouraged as it can result in oedema of the cervix, which 
may delay the progress of labour.
/circle6  Do not apply fundal pressure on the abdomen to facilitate expulsion of the baby.
